materials.raw_text: P: 12 g, Pr: 4 g, Ru: 19 g, Y: 1 g

sourcing.instructions: P (Phosphorus): Chemical supply store; Pr (Praseodymium): Online rare earth metal supplier; Ru (Ruthenium): Precious metal dealer; Y (Yttrium): Chemical supply store
steps: P (Phosphorus): Chemical supply store; Pr (Praseodymium): Online rare earth metal supplier; Ru (Ruthenium): Precious metal dealer; Y (Yttrium): Chemical supply store

1. Weigh 12 g of phosphorus, 4 g of praseodymium, 19 g of ruthenium, and 1 g of yttrium using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the weighed amounts of each element. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the mixture until it reaches a homogeneous powder consistency.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh 12 g of phosphorus, 4 g of praseodymium, 19 g of ruthenium, and 1 g of yttrium using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the weighed amounts of each element. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the mixture until it reaches a homogeneous powder consistency.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the homogeneous powder into a suitable crucible made of alumina. 3. Insert the crucible into the preheated furnace.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the homogeneous powder into a suitable crucible made of alumina. 3. Insert the crucible into the preheated furnace.

steps: 1. After 2 hours of heating, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 3. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours of heating, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 3. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the edges and surfaces as needed to achieve desired finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing agent if required for environmental protection.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the edges and surfaces as needed to achieve desired finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing agent if required for environmental protection.
